pnIntroData.name: Welcome
pnIntroData.summary: Pacing involves respecting your limits, conserving energy, avoiding flare-ups, increasing your tolerance, and improving your functioning. Use your pain diary to help identify ways you can better utilize our pacing strategies.
steps: First, establish your baseline: know when your pain moves from being “manageable” to “uncomfortable”
Establish time limits and baselines for each activity that keep you at a “manageable” level
Example: it takes Sue 10 minutes of vacuuming before her pain becomes uncomfortable. She divides that number in half (5 minutes) to establish an initial baseline

Remember to take incremental steps and frequent breaks so you don’t overdo it, gradually increase by a set time each week, and set SMART Goals you would like to accomplish and pace your way through them
